database

Class DataBaseCom

  • java.lang.Object
    • database.DataBaseCom

  • public class DataBaseCom
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the class containing methods and information required to connect to a database. It contains 2 major parts: the connection object and the Statement. While the connection maintains a link to the database, the Statement is responsible for any concrete communication. It's also through the statement that results from the database are passed. It should be noted that the connection does not close itself automatically, therefore every time the usage is done one should call the close().
    Author:
    STAHL7

    • Constructor Detail

      • DataBaseCom

        public DataBaseCom()
        The basic constructor for DataBaseCom. Constructs the object and opens the connection to the database.

    • Method Detail

      • reboot

        public void reboot()
        This method closes and re-opens the connection to the database.

      • close

        public void close()
        This method closes the database. If this fails, the method will print out some error information in the terminal.

      • update

        public boolean update(java.lang.String query)
               throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method is used for editing and deleting information in the database. The query passed to this method must be valid SQL syntax. If this fails the method will print out some error information in the terminal.
        Parameters:
        query - Some valid SQL syntax for editing or deleting entries in the database.
        Returns:
        boolean True if the query was successful, false if the query failed
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the query fails.

      • get

        public java.sql.ResultSet get(java.lang.String query)
                       throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method is used for retrieving information from the database as ResultSets. Note that this method uses a different query from the others - a query that can ONLY receive 'retrieval' commands.
        Parameters:
        query - Some valid SQL syntax for retrieving information from the database.
        Returns:
        ResultSet a ResultSet containing the information contained.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the query fails

      • create

        public java.sql.ResultSet create(java.lang.String query)
                          throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method is used when creating posts in a table in the database. The method will take in a query and ask for any auto generated keys. If the query fails some error information will be printed in the terminal.
        Parameters:
        query - Some valid SQL syntax for creating tables or posts in the database.
        Returns:
        ResultSet a ResultSet containing any autogenerated keys.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the query fails
